trans-unit.target: TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_000<tab>It's good to see you, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>.
TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_100<tab>I take it your skills as a gunbreaker are as sharp as ever.

TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_001_000<tab>So, you've been dabbling in other disciplines, have you? It's always good to have more than one trick up your sleeve. That's something I've come to understand from seeing the adventurers passing through here.

TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_002_000<tab>So, you've been dabbling in other disciplines, have you? It's always good to have more than one trick up your sleeve. But for people like Rostik and myself, we prefer to stick to what we know.
TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_Q1_000_000<tab>What will you ask?
TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_A1_000_001<tab>How fare you of late?
TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_A1_000_002<tab>What is a gunbreaker?
TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_A1_000_003<tab>Nothing.
TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_010<tab>Since arriving in Revenant's Toll, I've been working as a bodyguard for hire while looking for people to train in the art of the gunbreaker.
TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_011<tab>A few have shown promise, but none of them can hold a candle to you.

TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_012<tab>As for Sophie, she's been running around with other adventurers, looking for some sort of ancient artifacts called “stonetomes,” whatever they are. In any case, she's certainly settled in well here.

TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_013<tab>To tell the truth, this is the first time since fleeing the Empire that we've found any semblance of peace. We both learned a lot from traveling around Eorzea, but this is the only place we've really felt at home.
TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_110<tab>My countryman Rostik is hard at work building a new home for the survivors of Bozja.

TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_111<tab>I must admit that it was a great relief to discover that I was not the last of my kind, nor the last Bozjan gunbreaker. It also means that I need not be in such a hurry to find successors to inherit our techniques.

TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_112<tab>Having said that, I feel that I may best serve my countrymen by demonstrating the power of the gunbreaker to the people of Eorzea. Gaining a reputation as a dependable bodyguard is the first step.

TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_113<tab>It seems that Sophie is hoping to do something similar for the fallen city of Rabanastre, by sharing tales of her home in the Seventh Heaven. The patrons certainly make for an attentive audience, especially that minstrel fellow.
TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_114<tab>On the whole, I'd say coming here was the right decision. We never would have made it this far without your help, for which we are both extremely grateful.

TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_120<tab>We were recently approached by a man named Hoary Boulder, who needed assistance in defending the Ixal from imperials who had emerged from one of the Telophoroi's towers.

TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_121<tab>Imagine our surprise when during our mission, said tower suddenly vanished! It was only later that we learned its disappearance was due to your actions, as part of the Ilsabard contingent, many malms to the north.

TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_122<tab>As a matter of fact, you were not the only acquaintance of mine to join this collective of renowned warriors. My countryman, Rostik, was able to overcome his hatred for the Empire and lend his considerable strength to aiding its people. Perhaps you had occasion to speak with him?

TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_123<tab>In any case, now that the capital has fallen, it remains to be seen what will become of the formerly occupied territories. Whatever the future holds for our respective homelands, Sophie and I will endeavor to build better relations between them and Eorzea.
TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_020<tab>The story of the gunbreaker began in the Third Astral Era, when the Allagan Empire was at the height of its power.

TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_021<tab>We Hrothgar were far too few in number to stand against their overwhelming might, and did what was necessary to escape persecution, eking out a meager existence in the mountains.

TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_022<tab>In those days, we were ruled by Queen Gunnhildr, who was guarded by elite soldiers known as “Gunnhildr's Blades,” many of whom wielded aetherially imbued swords.

TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_023<tab>Over time, the name was shortened to “gunblade” and applied to the weapons themselves. They developed into an effective means of slaying our foes while keeping those around us from harm.

TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_024<tab>Eventually, it was our turn to face the Allagans in battle. They wielded firearms similar in appearance to our gunblades, but capable of launching projectiles over long distances. The word “gun” was used to describe these instruments of war.

TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_025<tab>Seeing that we stood little chance of victory against these guns, the queen's guard rushed headlong through the enemy lines for the sole purpose of destroying them. Thus did these brave heroes come to be called “gunbreakers.”
TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_026<tab>The Allagan Empire was eventually laid to waste by the Fourth Umbral Calamity, while our traditions and techniques lived on.
TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_027<tab>The descendants of the queen's gunbreakers could be found among the citizens of Bozja. After the fall of the citadel, I thought that I was the last of them.

TEXT_JOBDEFBGB_00621_RADOVAN_000_028<tab>Now, you are a part of this legacy. For the will to protect, the will to sacrifice yourself for the good of others is something that you share with the gunbreakers who have come before you.
